content.description: Sit start on a positive crimp rail low on the seam. Climb up the seam utilizing awful smears and jump to good holds on the lip.
content.location: North facing side of the boulder, obvious seam. The huecos near the top seem to fill with rat poop quite frequently

content.description: Sit start on opposing sloper and crimp, make a difficult deadpoint to a small crimp. Climb right via marginal holds in a seam and bring out you inner sports ball player to get to a gaston jug near the headwall. Top out as for Giant Steps.
content.location: The Left problem on the west facing overhang, between Legion of Boom and Giant Steps

content.description: Sit start on opposing sidepulls and pull through compression moves on good holds up to a distinct crux. A few desperate moves high on the wall leads to a victory toss to a sloper on the lip. Mantle is mellow. The Stand start from a right hand pinch and juggy left hand gaston is also a worthwhile problem checking in around V10.
content.location: On the N / NE facing overhung section of the wall.

content.description: High idle is on the smaller boulder directly behind the Legion boulder. It has some awesome movement on great holds. Great way to get the blood flowing for the harder problems. There are several ways up this boulder with varying levels of rock quality but the main line is rather good.
content.location: Directly across from the NE overhanging face of the Legion boulder

content.description: Sit start on a positive rail, climb through pockets eventually making a giant step on your way to sticking a challenging deadpoint to a positive crimp. Top out straight above.
content.location: East facing over hang the right most problem.

content.description: Dad Palace is another great line of positive holds that are helpful for getting the blood flowing. One can stand start, or fully sit start as for Legion of Boom which makes this problem range in difficulty. Climb up the massive holds out the juggy flake,  a boulder behind this problem adds a little spice to the slightly insecure top out, making a spot useful.
content.location: You can sit start Dad Palace as for Legion of Boom and then cut left topping out on better holds.

content.description: This  is the biggest and baddest boulder I have found on Mt. Elden. Don't be deterred by the long approach, the scenic views and quality boulders make it worth it. The Legion boulder offers a good mix of powerful as well as technical boulders. Some are relatively high ball where it's nice to have several pads and there are a few relatively safe problems as well. Bring as much foam as you can and enjoy! Grades are estimates as the boulders have not seen many ascents.
